fileBaselines.content:
# /* ---- ğŸ’« https://github.com/JaKooLit ğŸ’« ---- */  #
# Hypridle 
# Original config submitted by https://github.com/SherLock707                                                       
                                                      
$iDIR="$HOME/.config/swaync/images/ja.png"

general {
    lock_cmd = pidof hyprlock || hyprlock # runs hyprlock if it is not already running (this is always run when "loginctl lock-session" is called) 
    # unlock_cmd = killall hyprlock # kills hyprlock when unlocking (this is always run when "loginctl unlock-session" is called)
    before_sleep_cmd = loginctl lock-session    # ensures that the session is locked before going to sleep
    after_sleep_cmd = hyprctl dispatch dpms on # turn of screen after sleep (not strictly necessary, but just in case)
    ignore_dbus_inhibit = false             # whether to ignore dbus-sent idle-inhibit requests (used by e.g. firefox or steam)
}

# turn off screen faster if session is already locked
# (disabled by default)
# listener {
#     timeout = 30                            # 30 seconds
#     on-timeout = pidof hyprlock && hyprctl dispatch dpms off # turns off the screen if hyprlock is active
#     on-resume = pidof hyprlock && hyprctl dispatch dpms on    # command to run when activity is detected after timeout has fired.
# }

# Warn
listener {
    timeout = 540                  # 9 min
    on-timeout = notify-send -i $iDIR # command to run when timeout has passed
    on-resume = notify-send -i $iDIR " Oh! you're Back" " Hello !!!"  # command to run when activity is detected after timeout has fired.
}

# Screenlock
listener {
    timeout = 600                     # 10 min
    on-timeout = loginctl lock-session # command to run when timeout has passed
    #on-resume = notify-send -i $iDIR " System Unlocked!"  # command to run when activity is detected after timeout has fired.
}

# Turn off screen 
# (disabled by default)
# listener {
#     timeout = 630                            # 10.5 min
#     on-timeout = hyprctl dispatch dpms off  # command to run when timeout has passed
#     on-resume = hyprctl dispatch dpms on    # command to run when activity is detected after timeout has fired.
# }

# Suspend # disabled by default
# listener {
   # timeout = 1200                            # 20 min
   # on-timeout = systemctl suspend # command to run when timeout has passed
    # on-resume = notify-send -i $iDIR " Oh! you're back" "Hello !!!"  # command to run when activity is detected after timeout has fired.
# }

edits.text: # Omarchy Screensaver - Complete Analysis & Implementation Guide

The Omarchy screensaver is a terminal-based screensaver that uses **TTE (Terminal Text Effects)** to display animated ASCII art with various visual effects. It launches automatically after inactivity and exits on any user input.
â”‚  - Launches terminal on each monitor                         â”‚
â”‚  - Runs TTE with random effects                              â”‚
â”‚  - Monitors for keyboard/mouse input                         â”‚
â”‚  - Exits on any interaction                                  â”‚
â”‚  - Renders ASCII art with animations                         â”‚
â”‚  - Random effects (Matrix, Fireworks, etc.)                  â”‚
- **Role**: Monitors user inactivity and triggers actions
**Purpose**: Orchestrates the screensaver launch across all monitors
2. âœ… Prevent duplicate instances (check if already running)
3. âœ… Check if screensaver is disabled via toggle file
4. âœ… Close Walker overlay if open
7. â†©ï¸ Return focus to original monitor
- **Input Detection**: Monitors for any keyboard/mouse input
2. Hide cursor: hyprctl keyword cursor:invisible true
- Run TTE with random effect on ASCII art
- Check if screensaver window is still focused
- Exit if input detected or lost focus
The screensaver displays ASCII art from:

Replace `~/.config/screensaver/art.txt` with your own ASCII art:
# Use specific effect instead of random
Some popular effects you can use:
- `blackhole` - Text being sucked into a black hole
# Hyprland might not support cursor hiding
# Alternative: use TTE's built-in cursor hiding
Update the launcher script to use your preferred terminal (Ghostty or Kitty instead of Alacritty).
The Omarchy implementation launches a separate screensaver window on each monitor. This is handled in the launcher script loop.
The Omarchy screensaver is a elegant solution that:
1. âœ… Uses terminal + TTE for lightweight animation
2. âœ… Integrates with Hyprland's idle management
4. âœ… Responds instantly to user input
5. âœ… Customizable with various effects and ASCII art

The beauty is in its simplicity - it's just a terminal window running an animated text effect, made fullscreen and triggered automatically. No complex dependencies or heavy graphics frameworks needed!
â”‚    on-timeout = pidof hyprlock || omarchy-launch-screensaver       â”‚
â”‚  âœ“ Checks if screen is NOT locked (pidof hyprlock)                â”‚
â”‚  âœ“ If not locked â†’ Launch screensaver                             â”‚
â”‚  1. tte command exists? â”€â”€[NO]â”€â”€> EXIT                            â”‚
â”‚  2. Already running? â”€â”€[YES]â”€â”€> EXIT                              â”‚
â”‚  3. Disabled toggle file exists? â”€â”€[YES]â”€â”€> EXIT (unless forced)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Close Walker overlay (walker -q)                                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Get current focused monitor                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Get default terminal (xdg-terminal-exec --print-id)            â”‚
â”‚  LOOP FOR EACH MONITOR:                                            â”‚
â”‚  â”‚ for m in $(hyprctl monitors -j | jq -r '.[] | .name'); do   â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚   hyprctl dispatch focusmonitor $m                           â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚   case $terminal in                                          â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     *Alacritty*) Launch with Alacritty config                â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     *ghostty*)   Launch with Ghostty config                  â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     *kitty*)     Launch with Kitty config                    â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Restore original focused monitor                                â”‚
â”‚  TERMINAL LAUNCHES (one per monitor)                               â”‚
â”‚  HYPRLAND WINDOW RULES (applied automatically)                     â”‚
â”‚  windowrule = fullscreen on, match:class org.omarchy.screensaver  â”‚
â”‚  windowrule = float on, match:class org.omarchy.screensaver       â”‚
â”‚  âœ“ Window appears fullscreen                                      â”‚
â”‚  âœ“ Window is floating (not tiled)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â”‚ 1. Define helper functions:                                  â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚    â€¢ screensaver_in_focus() - Check if window is focused     â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚    â€¢ exit_screensaver() - Cleanup and exit                   â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚ 2. Set signal traps:                                         â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚    trap exit_screensaver SIGINT SIGTERM SIGHUP SIGQUIT      â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚ 3. Configure terminal:                                       â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚    â€¢ Set background to black (ANSI escape code)              â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚    â€¢ Hide cursor: hyprctl keyword cursor:invisible true      â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚ 4. Get TTY for process monitoring:                           â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚ while true; do                                               â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚   # Launch TTE with random effect                            â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     --canvas-width 0 \      # Auto-detect width              â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     --canvas-height 0 \     # Auto-detect height             â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     --reuse-canvas \         # Keep same canvas              â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     --anchor-canvas c \      # Center canvas                 â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     --anchor-text c \        # Center text                   â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     --random-effect \        # Random animation              â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     --exclude-effects dev_worm \ # Skip worm effect          â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     --no-eol \               # No end of line                â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     --no-restore-cursor &    # Don't restore cursor          â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚   # Monitor TTE process                                      â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚   while pgrep -t "${tty#/dev/}" -x tte >/dev/null; do       â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     # Check for input (1 second timeout)                     â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     if read -n1 -t 1; then                                   â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚       exit_screensaver  # User pressed key                   â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     # Check if window still has focus                        â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚     if ! screensaver_in_focus; then                          â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚       exit_screensaver  # User switched window               â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚   # TTE finished, loop again with new random effect          â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Reads ASCII art from file                                       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Applies random animation effect                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Renders at 120 FPS                                              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Auto-sizes to terminal dimensions                               â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Centers content on screen                                       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Matrix - Falling characters like Matrix movie                   â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Fireworks - Explosive animations                                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Rain - Falling rain effect                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Decrypt - Decryption sequence animation                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Synthgrid - Retro synthwave grid                                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Blackhole - Text sucked into black hole                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Beams - Light beam effects                                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ ... and many more!                                              â”‚
â”‚  When effect completes, the loop starts again with new effect      â”‚
â”‚  (Keyboard press, mouse move, or window loses focus)               â”‚
â”‚     hyprctl keyword cursor:invisible false                         â”‚
â”‚  3. Kill all screensaver windows:                                  â”‚

2. **TTE animates ASCII art** with random effects (Matrix, Fireworks, etc.)
3. **Bash script monitors input** and exits immediately when detected
4. **Hyprland makes it fullscreen** automatically via window rules
No complex frameworks, no heavy graphicsâ€”just terminal + text effects!
The launcher script launches a separate instance on each monitor. You can modify `screensaver-launcher.sh` to use different ASCII art per monitor.

1. TTE (Terminal Text Effects) - The animation engine that makes it cool
2. Hypridle - Detects when you're idle and triggers the screensaver
3. Hyprland - Makes the terminal fullscreen automatically
4. Bash scripts - Glue everything together and handle input detection
The screensaver is just a fullscreen terminal running TTE!
SCREENSAVER_README.md               Quick start guide (5 min setup)

complete replication package for you. Here's what's included:

â€¢ Runs TTE with random effects
â€¢ Launches fullscreen terminal on each
HOW THE OMARCHY SCREENSAVER WORKS (Simple Explanation)
The Omarchy screensaver is beautifully simple:
1. You stop using your computer for 2.5 minutes
2. Hypridle (idle daemon) notices and triggers the screensaver
3. A fullscreen terminal opens on each monitor
4. TTE (Terminal Text Effects) displays animated ASCII art
5. Random effects cycle: Matrix â†’ Fireworks â†’ Rain â†’ etc.
6. You press ANY key â†’ Everything exits immediately
That's it! No complex graphics, no heavy frameworks. Just:
â€¢ TTE animating text (with cool effects)
â€¢ A bash script (monitoring for exit)

â””â”€ 30+ effects: Matrix, Fireworks, Rain, Decrypt, Synthgrid, etc.

â””â”€ Provides hyprctl for window control
â””â”€ Idle detection daemon for Hyprland
â””â”€ Runs fullscreen with black background
â””â”€ Runs TTE in a loop

# Safe implementation without modifying existing configs

for cmd in hyprctl tte jq alacritty; do

# Exit the screensaver on signals and input from keyboard and mouse

printf '\033]11;rgb:00/00/00\007'  # Set background color to black
notify-send "Screensaver Error" "TTE (Terminal Text Effects) not installed"
# Check if screensaver is already running
for monitor in $(hyprctl monitors -j 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.[] | .name'); do

echo -e "${GREEN}âœ¨ Setup complete! Enjoy your screensaver! âœ¨${NC}"
